newsitem.title: USA: Cablevision seeks TCI customers -- WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Cablevision seeks TCI customers -- WSJ.

text.p: Cablevision Systems Corp is near a deal to acquire a large number of New York-area subscribers from Tele-Communications Inc (TCI) in a deal worth more than $1 billion, the Wall Street Journal said.

The newspaper said in Monday's electronic edition that under the transaction, Cablevision would exchange new shares of its stock at about $400 million and would assume about $675 million of debt from TCI.

That would give TCI, the nation's largest cable operator, about 33 percent of Cablevision's stock. The controlling Dolan family of Cablevision, the sixth-largest U.S. cable operator, would retain voting of Cablevision.
TCI is offering to contribute about 820,000 subscribers in the New York area, the Journal said.

TCI President Leo Hindery, who has expressed a desire to reduce the company's debt load and to restructure its operations, is expected to announce other partnerships with other cable operators over the next several weeks.
